Posted By: Binaro (4/28/2012 10:50:08 AM)

posts.post_content:
Yea the card's ability can be made advantageous, but in general it's a drawback on a 4/5 for 6 mana. You could probably make an O.K. limited deck with this guy having a role, but I wouldn't try it.  
I'd say that it's a build around card that doesn't deserve to be built around.   
1/5

Posted By: ZEvilMustache (4/28/2012 11:15:58 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: *We think this card made us throw up in our mouths a little bit. Non-optional return-to-hand effects are cool. 6 mana 4/5s are not. Cards like this should be costed as if the effect is a drawback (but not too crazily undercosted!), like [Stampeding Serow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stampeding Serow). That way you're encouraged to take advantage of its ability rather than punished for doing so. [Roaring Primadox](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Roaring Primadox) is acceptable.*
posts.html:
We think this card made us throw up in our mouths a little bit. Non-optional return-to-hand effects are cool. 6 mana 4/5s are not. Cards like this should be costed as if the effect is a drawback (but not too crazily undercosted!), like Stampeding Serow. That way you're encouraged to take advantage of its ability rather than punished for doing so. Roaring Primadox is acceptable.
